Articles.Content:
2 hours ago, SQUAD said:
which will be coming some time over the next few weeks. 

As long as it's not in a COUPLE weeks.
I for one would value a stable 1.1.x far more than 1.2  I haven't gotten a proper career rolling since 1.1 due to the bugs

37 minutes ago, WildLynx said:

What is the status of telescope from Asteroid Day? Do SQUAD plans to update it as mod, or add it into stock or it will be updated much later?

@Arsonide mentioned in this recent post that he's working on updating the official mods now that he's back from vacation. No mention though if the telescope will be added to stock AFAIK...
Are there any plans to use the new multi monitor features in Unity 5.3?

15 minutes ago, CliftonM said:

Are there any plans to use the new multi monitor features in Unity 5.3?

I sure hope so!!!

Glad to hear you all are back and that things are finally being worked on again.  

As others have said, there should be no other focus than getting the big "stability patch' stable before moving on to any new content....
Please fix 8241. Then fix wheels. Then fix the other things. Then start working on 1.2 and other new stuff. And please take your time (well, not for 8241 ).

As for 1.2, is it time for that something that rhymes with shmelta-vee?

Oh, and....
Well, at least we are getting an update. The bad side is, the update isn't bug focused.

2 hours ago, swjr-swis said:

So... do I have to be the one to point out that 'a' (aka one, 1) broken finger doth not make 'a few' injuries, not even for exceptionally large values of one?

What other injuries are we not being informed of? The public needs to know!

 

I have it on good authority that someone ate ice cream too fast and got a headache.  It was touch and go for a while but he did survive.  Naturally they didn't want to mention it out of respect for the victim and his family.

Edited May 25, 2016 by Alshain
How about fixing the exploding Landing Legs?  Enough players are having problems, so it's not a one-off situation.  Been around a long time, too.

Welcome back, hope you had a good holiday.

 

It's good to see you getting started with 1.2, also glad your going to be patching it beforehand. Patch 1.1.3 here we come!

 

Keep up the great work guys!

Welcome back! I hope you're all well rested and all had great respective times on vacation.

20 minutes ago, HoloYolo said:

Well, at least we are getting an update. The bad side is, the update isn't bug focused.

The most substantive thing in the post was this:

4 hours ago, SQUAD said:

At the top of our agenda we find patch 1.1.3, which will be coming some time over the next few weeks. Despite the fact that a lot of effort went into making 1.1 and the subsequent patches as stable as possible we see that some of you are still having various crashing issues, amongst a few other things we want to resolve. Results indicate that at least one or two crashing issues have indeed been fixed already.

They didn't actually use the word "bug" but it seems pretty obvious that priority #1 is - at least - the worst of the current 1.1.2 bugs.

Edited May 25, 2016 by 5thHorseman
As is common, what I saw in the wysiwyg editor was not what I got.

4 hours ago, Alshain said:

First welcome back.

Second, I have to say I don't like the sound of that.  You're going to try to fix the outstanding issues at the same time as introducing  a whole bunch of new features in 1.2.  Can't we get a fix to the problems first?  Let's get one stable version that we can actually play, and THEN add all the new features you like.  My opinion, which may not be worth much, is make the Unity fixing path a separate entity from new features.  I certainly look forward to new features, but on the other hand it seems like each version has some outstanding issue and we never will truly get a nice stable version, simply because all of the fixes are coupled with a bunch of buggy new features.

Am I the only one that feels this way?  I don't feel like I'm crazy, but I suppose if I were I'd be the last to know.

EDIT: I will say I am pleased to see the "most promising discussions" line.  It's always nice when you take community suggestions into consideration, even if they don't pan out.

This. Point #2. While I've never been a software dev, I have done some technical writing, and on every design project I've worked on, we had a point called "design lock" where no new features or additions were allowed. Then we worked that version until it was production ready and rejected the urge to add shiny new things. The new features went into a pipeline for future design, but were not looked at until the current version was in full release and we were ready to start on the next iteration.  

I think Squad could benefit from adopting feature lock and not working on tangential projects and resisting feature creep until the current version is stable and mostly bug-free. 

Edited May 25, 2016 by JJE64
Stupid iPhone keyboard

Just now, JJE64 said:

This. Point #2. While I've never been a software dev, I have done some technical writing, and on every design project I've worked on, we had a point called "design lock" where no new features or additions were allowed. Then we worked that version until it was production ready and rejected the urge to add shiny new things. The new features went into a pipeline for future design, but were not looked at until the current version was in full release and we were ready to start on the next iteration.  

I think Sauad could benefit from adopting feature lock and not working on tangential projects and resisting feature creep until the current version is stable and mostly big-free. 

They have one, but last time I saw it mentioned, it happened like 24 hours before release of 1.0.  Hardly enough time to fix problems.

Hope you all had a good 'break'.  'Scratch' that.  

Priority bug for me is the CTD when building in the VAB or SPH.  Building craft for my career is the real joy of the game for me after a long day of work.  It is tinged with an uncomfortable feeling that a crash is imminent these days.

That's not really locking in the design then.  LOL.  I swear KSP is the textbook outcome of feature creep.  If KSP were a house, it would have 7 floors, only the first 3 would have windows, the front door would require a locksmith to open, and the top 4 floors would be in a perpetual state of construction, but yet never any nearer to completion.  And it wouldn't take long until plans would be announced for an 8th floor!  

Don't get me wrong, I applaud the fantastic job the devs have done getting us here, and for a labor of love, KSP is an incredible product.  But the production seems very unfocused at times.

Kind of a weird dynamic happening- stability/optimization needed, but a chunk of that will come from the Unity update. My gut tells me fix the CTDs in 1.1.x and proceed to 1.2 with the Unity upgrade and satellite stuff, this time with a longer beta period. It seems to me this community is pretty patient and is more than willing to wait for a quality release as opposed to a quicker one- the 1.05-1.1 period proves this.  Hopefully upgrading U5 versions will be pretty straightforward code-wise.

1 minute ago, JJE64 said:

That's not really locking in the design then.  LOL.  I swear KSP is the textbook outcome of feature creep.  If KSP were a house, it would have 7 floors, only the first 3 would have windows, the front door would require a locksmith to open, and the top 4 floors would be in a perpetual state of construction, but yet never any nearer to completion.  And it wouldn't take long until plans would be announced for an 8th floor!  

Don't get me wrong, I applaud the fantastic job the devs have done getting us here, and for a labor of love, KSP is an incredible product.  But the production seems very unfocused at times.

I would like this post, but I'm only allowed 25 likes every 24 hours.

3 minutes ago, JJE64 said:

That's not really locking in the design then.  LOL.  I swear KSP is the textbook outcome of feature creep.  If KSP were a house, it would have 7 floors, only the first 3 would have windows, the front door would require a locksmith to open, and the top 4 floors would be in a perpetual state of construction, but yet never any nearer to completion.  And it wouldn't take long until plans would be announced for an 8th floor!  

Don't get me wrong, I applaud the fantastic job the devs have done getting us here, and for a labor of love, KSP is an incredible product.  But the production seems very unfocused at times.

Well, I agree, but I have to step back and remember this is their first project.  It takes time to learn stuff like that.  It's easy to get frustrated because I've been on some rather seasoned development teams, but not every team has that kind of expertise and control.

Edited May 25, 2016 by Alshain

To the people saying they should fix the bugs before moving onto new features. Read the bleeding devnotes people! That is exactly what they are saying they are going to do. They literally say its the first thing on their agenda.

Edited May 25, 2016 by Tourist

Just now, Tourist said:

To the people saying they should fix the bugs before moving onto new features. Read the bleeding devnotes people! That is exactly what they are saying.

"Next on the list is planning for update 1.2: this update will most likely contain a minor update of the Unity game engine which should fix various outstanding issues"

Not entirely

4 minutes ago, Alshain said:

"Next on the list is planning for update 1.2: this update will most likely contain a minor update of the Unity game engine which should fix various outstanding issues"

Not entirely

Respectfully, you skipped a paragraph there.

They didn't use the exact words "bugfixing" but to quote Squad:  "At the top of our agenda we find patch 1.1.3, which will be coming some time over the next few weeks. Despite the fact that a lot of effort went into making 1.1 and the subsequent patches as stable as possible we see that some of you are still having various crashing issues, amongst a few other things we want to resolve. Results indicate that at least one or two crashing issues have indeed been fixed already." Emphasis mine. No talk about adding features in this first agenda item.

 

Edited May 25, 2016 by Tourist

2 minutes ago, Tourist said:

They didn't use the exact words "bugfixing" but to quote Squad:  "At the top of our agenda we find patch 1.1.3, which will be coming some time over the next few weeks. Despite the fact that a lot of effort went into making 1.1 and the subsequent patches as stable as possible we see that some of you are still having various crashing issues, amongst a few other things we want to resolve. Results indicate that at least one or two crashing issues have indeed been fixed already." Emphasis mine. No talk about adding features in this first agenda item.

I don't think it's much about the semantics of the paragraph.  It's more that the Dev Notes message wasn't "WE'RE BACK, GUYS! Don't worry, we're here to save you, and quickly!" but instead was a bit more like, "Business as usual!"

6 minutes ago, Tourist said:

They didn't use the exact words but to quote Squad:  "At the top of our agenda we find patch 1.1.3, which will be coming some time over the next few weeks. Despite the fact that a lot of effort went into making 1.1 and the subsequent patches as stable as possible we see that some of you are still having various crashing issues, amongst a few other things we want to resolve. Results indicate that at least one or two crashing issues have indeed been fixed already." Emphasis mine. No talk about adding features in this first agenda item.

 

Except it doesn't matter.  1.1.3 won't fix the outstanding issues because 1.2 clearly says it will.  Sure it might fix some of them, but I have a feeling that without the Unity update it won't even fix all of the most egregious ones.   We are pretty confident the wheel issues and landing leg issues are Unity, which means 1.1.3 will be as useless as 1.1.2.  Thus, the bugs will not be fixed before new features are added.

Edited May 25, 2016 by Alshain
